text: — Electrolytes + Dissociate into ions in water — Examples: inorganic salts, all acids and bases, some proteins * lons conduct electrical current » Greater osmotic power than non-electrolytes — Greater ability to cause fluid shifts due to ability to dissociate into two or more ions —NaCl 1 Na* + CI (electrolyte; 2 particles) — MgCl, (1 Mg?* + 2CI- (electrolyte; 3 particles) — glucose 1 glucose (nonelectrolyte; 1 particle)
